sense.name: something which exemplifies an attribute or state
sense.examples: Betty is the embodiment of vitality. A career in Hollywood is the embodiment of his dreams. Sally thought Mary's dinner party was the embodiment of sophistication.

sense.name: a concrete form that visually represents an abstraction
sense.examples: In these early societies, the round wooden totems were the embodiment of fertility. The circle motif in this jewelry is the embodiment of the concept of life.

sense.name: act of giving concrete form to an abstraction
sense.examples: It was in New York that his aspirations finally seemed capable of emodiment. The mime artist's embodiment of sorrow and then happiness was very convincing.
